subject: Politics
title: The Strait of Hormuz
description: A fast breakdown of The Strait of Hormuz for builders.

hook.text: One-fifth of the world's oil passes through a waterway 21 miles wide. Iran sits on one side with missiles aimed.

buildup.text: The Strait of Hormuz connects the Persian Gulf to the open ocean. It's the most important oil chokepoint on Earth.

discovery.text: Iran has threatened to close the strait during every major crisis. Closure would spike oil prices overnight.

twist.text: The US Navy patrols these waters constantly. A single incident could escalate into a regional war.

climax.text: As the world shifts to renewables, Hormuz's importance will fade. But that transition is decades away.

punchline.text: Hormuz is a 21-mile bottleneck for the global economy. Narrow and dangerous.

quiz.question: Why is the Strait of Hormuz so strategically important?
options: One-fifth of the world's oil supply passes through it
It connects the Atlantic and Pacific oceans
It's the world's busiest passenger shipping lane
